How Israel tracked down and assassinated scientists involved in Iran's nuclear program
description: Israel's attacks in June killed 16 leading researchers involved in Iran's efforts to develop an atomic bomb. Some of them had been under Israeli intelligence surveillance for two decades. With their deaths, Israel believes it has dealt the most decisive blow yet to Tehran's military nuclear program.

headline: Macron calls for new era of Franco-British unity in address to UK Parliament
Flights suspended at Marseille Airport due to nearby wildfire
EU prosecutors open probe into Le Pen's RN party and allies for misuse of funds
description: The Rassemblement National and its far-right allies from the defunct Identity and Democracy group are suspected of having improperly spent €4.3 million of European Parliament funds, according to a report revealed by Le Monde and its partners.

headline: 'The Hunger Games' in Gaza
description: The determination of the US and Israel to remove the United Nations from Gaza has already led to the deaths of hundreds of civilians during distributions of 'inhumane aid,' writes Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

headline: Pogacar credits 'big adrenalin' for explosive Tour de France stage and 100th career win
description: Slovenien Tadej Pogacar dropped all rivals one by one to take Tour de France stage four at Rouen on Tuesday, July 8, with only Mathieu van der Poel of the Netherlands and Jonas Vingegaard of Denmark offering a real challenge.

description: While local authorities hailed the decision, conservators warned of the risks of moving such a fragile work across the Channel.

Channel crossings by migrants in small boats are on the rise
description: Since the beginning of the year, more than 20,000 men, women and children have managed to reach the United Kingdom – 7,000 more than during the same period in 2024. At least 15 people have died while attempting the crossing.

headline: The relentless rush to build dams in China's Tiger Leaping Gorge: 'If we lose our land, we lose everything'
description: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (5/6). In the far southwest of China, plans to build massive reservoirs as part of hydroelectric dam projects have condemned dozens of mountain villages to disappear.

headline: Iranian photographer Forough Alaei portrays life during the war: 'Nothing will ever be the same again'
description: After the first Israeli bombings in Iran, Iranian photographer Forough Alaei left Tehran to take refuge with her family on the Caspian Sea coast. She documented those days when war plunged them into the unknown.
